text.p: EchoCath Inc said Monday it entered into an exclusive license agreement with Medtronic Inc, a Minneapolis-based manufacturer of heart pacemakers and pacemaker leads.
The agreement calls for Medtronic to employ certain of EchoCath's proprietary technologies to enable the positioning of pacemaker leads within the heart with conventional ultrasound imaging systems.

Under the agreement, EchoCath said, it will receive a series of payments at stipulated "milestones" in the development process, and then royalties when products incorporating its proprietary technologies are commercially available.

"This alliance with an entity the size and prestige of Medtronic marks a milestone in our passage from a development-stage company to an operating company," EchoCath President Frank DeBernardis said in a statement.

"There is substantial opportunity for both parties, especially since we believe that an ultrasound-guided implantation system will afford economic as well as procedural benefits to practitioners," DeBernardis added.
EchoCath develops, manufactures and markets medical devices that enhance and expand the use of ultrasound technology.
Medtronic is a medical technology company specializing in implantable and invasive therapies.
